question: How to make a vodka and soda?

option2: Put some ice in a glass. Measure an ounce and a half of soda in a glass. Finish the cocktail with vodka.

question: What's a way to take my dog for a walk?
option1: Introduce him to the collar or harness and leash. ...    Teach a cue. ...    Make him come to you. ...    Practice inside. ...    Take it outside. ...    If he pulls: If your dog starts pulling in the other direction, turn yourself into “a tree.”

question: To melt the marshmallows for the marshmallow jello fondant
option1: melt the marshmallows for 50 seconds on half power, take out and stir, melt for 45 seconds on half power, and mix one more time
option2: freeze the marshmallows for 50 seconds on half power, take out and stir, melt for 45 seconds on half power, and mix one more time

option2: install window insulation washer fluid, seal with a hair dryer

question: If you don't own an ironing board
option1: throw your wrinkled clothes in a dryer for thirty minutes with a wet sock.
option2: throw your wrinkled clothes in a dryer for thirty minutes with a wet hand.

question: To separate egg yolks from egg whites for a recipe, you can
option1: Crack the egg and carefully catch the yolk in the shell
option2: Crack the egg and carefully catch the white in the shell

question: How to check level with containers on wood plank.
option1: Using a level, place it on the corner of the plank with the containers a few inches apart. If it is showing it is leveled, then leave, if it is not then adjust plank.
option2: Using a level, place it on the middle of the plank with the containers a few inches apart. If it is showing it is leveled, then leave, if it is not then adjust plank.

question: How can I save my milk if I am going to be leaving town for a bit?
option1: Freeze the milk, but make sure the jug is not more than 5/4 full at most. Then just let the milk thaw when you get back.
option2: Freeze the milk, but make sure the jug is not more than 3/4 full at most. Then just let the milk thaw when you get back.
